Hello John, I wanted to thank you for the work you’ve done teaching Angular. I’ve been using your Pluralsight courses and your github repos as a resource as I continue to learn the framework.

I wanted to ask you a question about something I found in https://github.com/johnpapa/ng-demos/blob/master/modular/src/client/app/core/dataservice.js

It seems to me, when you return the promise from the catch() in both getAvengers() and getAvengersCount(), that promise will always be resolved (and not rejected). This is because each then or catch in a promise chain returns a new promise that is only rejected if you throw or return a rejected promise from one of your handlers. If you attempt to chain off that promise, as you do in https://github.com/johnpapa/ng-demos/blob/master/modular/src/client/app/avengers/avengers.js, the success callback is always called. In this particular case, the data is undefined, and nothing depends on there being data so it works.

Was this your intention?
